page.title: 20NEWS STORY UNEMPLOYMENT
page.content: The local paper in Hull is called 'The Daily Mail' and its main headline is about youth unemployment. The headline is this, 'YOUNG JOBLESS HITS AN ALL TIME RECORD'. There are now 17,250 young people claiming benefits as they have not got a job, and this does not include the people who left school in the summer because they cannot claim benefit until September. These figures are for the County of Humberside but those for Hull alone do not make good reading, there are 9,186 young people unemployed. As for total unemployment in the city, there are 23,491 people unemployed and claiming benefit, nearly 10% of the population of Hull. Nationally there are 3,235,036 people unemployed and claiming benefit and this does not include 134,455 school leavers.
